member.name: T:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.DPIMatchedImageResourceKey
member.summary: Represents an image resource key that matches with current device's DPI.

member.name: T:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.ImageResourceKey
member.summary: Represents a resource key of an image.
member.remarks:
An image resource key, naturally expressed as a string, should follow the following format:
<resource-name>[_<width>x<height>]
resource-nameName of the resource.
widthWidth of the resource.
heightHeight of the resource.
Consider the following 3 image resource keys:
Save_16x16
Save_32x32
Save_64x64
All of them have been designed to render a "Save" button.
There are 3 sizes. At runtime, framework will select the image resource that matches best with the device's current DPI value from the above resource key set.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.FndColors.FromName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Color structure from the specified name of a predefined color.
member.param: A string that is the name of a predefined color.
member.returns: The Color that this method creates.
member.remarks: If the name parameter is not the valid name of a predefined color, the FromName method creates a Color structure that has an ARGB value of 0 (that is, all ARGB components are 0).

For example, this may represent an element in a 'color palette' of a theme. In that case, the color palette would comprise of a set of elements, each representing a unique color, identified by a unique name.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.FndThemeManager.GetBitmap(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Overloaded. Should be used by Controls. Takes a resource key i.e. resource owner + "/" + resource name, as in parameter and returns a Bitmap represented by that resource key. When this method is called for the first time for a particular resource key, resulting Bitmap object is cached in memory for fast reference in future.
If bitmap is cached (default) the caller should not dispose it (or call in a using-statement) since that will leave a Disposed Bitmap object in the cache. Since the cache is per UI thread / per Explorer, when the Explorer closes, it will clean up the cache and dispose all Bitmaps.
member.param: The resource key of the Bitmap.
False to dismiss the caching of the bitmap. Use this if you want to Dispose the Bitmap explicitly. Default is true, and Bitmap is cached
member.returns: Requested bitmap, if found. If not, a placeholder bitmap.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.FndThemeManager.GetBitmap(System.String,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: See GetBitmap(string)
member.param: The resource key of the Bitmap.
Defaultvalue used if no themed bitmap is found
False to dismiss the caching of the bitmap. Use this if you want to Dispose the Bitmap explicitly. Default is true, and Bitmap is cached
member.returns: Requested bitmap, if found. If not, the defaultValue given.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.FndThemeManager.GetBitmap(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overloaded. Should be used by Controls. Takes resource key i.e. resource owner + "/" + resource name, and cacheResource as in parameters and returns a Bitmap represented by that resource key. When this method is called for the first time for a particular resource key, resulting Bitmap object is optionally cached in memory for fast reference in future.
member.param: The resource key of the Bitmap.
true to add resulting Bitmap in resource cache; otherwise, false.
If true, returns the size that fits best with the device's current DPI; false returns the exact size specified by the resource key.

Determines how to handle the situation when the bitmap designated by given resourceKey is not found. In such case, if suppressNotFoundImage is true, null will be returned. If false, a built-in placeholder image is returned.
member.returns: Bitmap that suites the device's current DPI level the best, out of all versions present, of different sizes. null / a built-in placeholder image, if no resource matching the given resource key can be found. If matchDPI is set to false, DPI matching is not performed and the image that corresponds to given resourceKey is returned.

member.returns: Bitmap that matches with given resource key. null if no resource matching the given resource key can be found.

member.name: T:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.ImageResourceKeyParser
member.summary: Parses given image resource key.
member.remarks:
Image resource keys that support the following format are supported:
<resource-name>[_<width>x<height>]
For example, the following resource key formats are supported:
FNDWIN/Save_40x40Resource with the size (width and height) specified.
FNDWIN/SaveResource without any size (width and height) specified. Note, this is mainly to provide backward compatibility.
Width and Height must be digits.

member.name: M:Ifs.Fnd.ThemeManager.ImageResourceKeyParser.ExtractName(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts the resource-name component from given resource key.
member.param: resource key
member.returns: resource-name of given resource key.

members.member:
Parses given resource key so that we know the elements that it is composed of.
.
